required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Study of Intraoperative CA-008 Administration in Subjects Undergoing Bunionectomy

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase 2, open-label study of CA-008 to evaluate post-surgical pain control with CA-008.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase 2, single-center, open-label study evaluating a single dose of CA-008 4.2 mg administered with different standard-of-care anesthetic regimens during an elective unilateral transpositional first metatarsal osteotomy for the correction of hallux valgus deformity (bunionectomy).

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Numerical Rating Scale (NRS) Scores (at Rest) Over 72h
primary_outcome.description: Area Under the Curve of pain intensity scores (using a Numeric Rating Scale of pain intensity from 0-10 where 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst pain imaginable) over 72 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Pain Intensity Scores at 24 Hours at Rest Using Numerical Rating Scale (NRS)
primary_outcome.description: Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) of pain intensity from 0-10 where 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst pain imaginable at 24 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Pain Intensity Scores at 48 Hours at Rest Using Numerical Rating Scale (NRS)
primary_outcome.description: Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) of pain intensity from 0-10 where 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst pain imaginable at 48 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Pain Intensity Scores at 72 Hours at Rest Using Numerical Rating Scale (NRS)
primary_outcome.description: Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) of pain intensity from 0-10 where 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst pain imaginable at 72 hours

secondary_outcome.description: Summary of opioid consumption in oral morphine equivalents

arm_group.description: CA-008 4.2 mg reconstituted in saline All subjects received monitored anesthesia care (MAC) and a Mayo block followed by a sciatic (popliteal) nerve block.
CA-008 4.2 mg reconstituted in saline All subjects received monitored anesthesia care (MAC) and a Mayo block.
CA-008 4.2 mg reconstituted in saline All subjects received monitored anesthesia care (MAC) and a Mayo block.
106 mg [8 mL of the 133 mg/10 mL suspension] only All subjects received monitored anesthesia care (MAC) and a Mayo block.

intervention.description: Drug: CA-008 4.2 mg reconstituted in saline
30 mg IV at the onset of anesthesia
1 g at the onset of anesthesia
100 mcg IV fentanyl administered at the onset of anesthesia and additional 50 mcg near the end of surgery
1.5% 12 mL at the end of surgery
200 mg PO bid each day postoperative
2% 15 mL at the end of surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy adult aged 18 - 65 years old
2. American Society of Anesthesiology (ASA) physical Class 1, 2 or 3
3. Planning elective Bunionectomy repair
4. For both males and females: using an acceptable method of birth control
5. If a female: not pregnant or breastfeeding
6. Have a body mass index â‰¤ 36 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Have another painful condition, other than bunion-related pain, that may require pain treatment during the study period
2. Have active skin disease or another abnormality at the anticipated site of surgery that could interfere with the planned surgery.
3. Have a known allergy to study medications.
4. Have a history of significant medical, neuropsychiatric or other condition, including a clinically significant abnormal clinical laboratory test values
5. Have positive results on the alcohol test (breath or saliva) or urine drug screen.

group.title: CA-008 Cohort 1
group.description: CA-008 4.2 mg All subjects received monitored anesthesia care (MAC) and a Mayo block followed by a sciatic (popliteal) nerve block. CA-008: Drug: CA-008 4.2 mg Ketorolac: 30 mg IV at the onset of anesthesia Acetaminophen IV: 1 g at the onset of anesthesia Fentanyl: 100 mcg IV fentanyl administered at the onset of anesthesia and additional 50 mcg near the end of surgery Bupivacaine Hydrochloride: 0.25% 30 mL (75 mg) prior to surgery Lidocaine HCl: 1.5% 12 mL at the end of surgery Celecoxib: 200 mg PO bid each day postoperative Acetaminophen Oral: 1 g postoperative

group.title: CA-008 Cohort 2
group.description: CA-008 4.2 mg All subjects received monitored anesthesia care (MAC) and a Mayo block. Ketorolac: 30 mg IV at the onset of anesthesia Acetaminophen IV: 1 g at the onset of anesthesia Fentanyl: 100 mcg IV fentanyl administered at the onset of anesthesia and additional 50 mcg near the end of surgery Bupivacaine Hydrochloride: 0.25% 30 mL (75 mg) prior to surgery Lidocaine Hydrochloride: 2% 15 mL at the end of surgery Exparel: Bupivacaine liposome injection suspension

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 76 days: Screening period from 45 days prior to surgery (D-45) to D29Â±2 Study Completion Visit. Unscheduled visits or visits after D29 might be necessary to assess ongoing safety issues or to follow an event to resolution or to establishment of a new baseline.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
